ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I developed a better understanding of both spoken and written German, with an emphasis on improving my vocabulary and use of complex grammatical structures in everyday speech.
By taking this class I was able to develop my grammar, writing, reading and speaking skills.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The course is quite clearly organized and we are given a variety of assignments where the expectations for us are clear. However, I think that our textbook is not very well organized, particularly in terms of grammar.
The course was great! The professor adapted the schedule according to our needs.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, definitely take GMAN 140 if you enjoy the language and wish to continue!

I would definitely recommend this course to anyone interested in learning German! You have to put in the effort though. We did a lot of context based vocabulary learning and grammar, and read interesting texts, including important works by Kafka and Drrenmatt. The topics that we discussed in the class were very engaging, and applicable to the real world (refugee crisis in Germany, German expressionism and Bauhaus, politics etc.).
